;;10 月 28 日，从掸邦北部腊戍镇的缅甸军事基地发射了一枚导弹，该基地是军方所在地努力应对新的攻势。
;

;缅甸军方正面临自两年多前政变夺取政权以来最大的军事挑战，此前反对派联盟切断了主要贸易路线并占领了中国边境附近的城镇和数十个前哨基地。

;

;分析人士称，少数民族武装团体联盟与新的反政变团体协调发起的掸邦北部攻势对军方来说是一次重大打击，可能会被武装分子利用。据报道，他们的进攻遭到了军方的空袭，军政府领导人敏昂莱誓言要反击他们的进攻。这些组织能否保住其夺取的领土还有待观察。

;

;周一，联合国警告称，激烈的战斗已造成平民伤亡，并导致超过 30,000 人流离失所。

;
;

;;相关：;;美国制裁缅甸军政府控制的国家国有石油天然气企业;

;
;

;Tar Parn La，塔昂民族解放军发言人兼副将领，该民族解放军是组成兄弟会联盟的三个组织之一，领导了这次行动，告诉卫报，它已经占领了 100 多个军事哨所。无法核实这一说法。

;

;军方上周承认，它已经失去了几个城镇，其中包括与中国云南省接壤的战略重镇 Chinshwehaw。今年 4 月至 9 月期间，缅甸与中国价值 18 亿美元的边境贸易中，有四分之一以上经过该镇。

;

;战斗的升级凸显了缅甸与北京关系的紧张，这是缅甸仅存的少数几个国家之一。盟国。中国呼吁边境稳定，并数月以来一直表示希望缅甸打击该地区针对本国国民的犯罪诈骗活动。分析人士称，军方未能采取行动，但兄弟会联盟现已承诺采取行动。

; ;

;缅甸军队;在 2021 年 2 月的政变中夺取政权;，此后面临公众的坚决反对，其中包括许多人拿起武器并组建人民国防军以推翻其统治。这些团体还得到了一些少数民族武装组织的支持，这些组织几十年来一直与军队进行斗争，争取更大的独立性。

;

;这场攻势于 10 月 27 日开始，由兄弟会联盟领导，包括三个少数民族武装组织理查德·霍西表示，此次行动进展如此之快反映了士气低落和军事资源压力。 ，国际危机组织的缅甸顾问，该组织是一个对世界各地冲突进行分析的非营利组织。他说，这对军方来说是一个危险的时刻，但他补充说，目前尚不清楚攻势将如何展开。

;

;“这要么表明缅甸军队比人们想象的要弱得多 –然后其他团体可能会认为这是一个信号……现在是发动战争的正确时机。或者，如果[军方]能够采取相当有力的反应，人们可能[决定]我们应该保持低调，”霍西说。

;

;掸邦北部腊戍的一名当地居民告诉《卫报》 10 月 27 日凌晨，当攻势开始时，她可以看到导弹降落在大约 15 分钟车程外的山区军营上。

;

;“北掸邦对武装冲突，但我以前从未见过这么多导弹，也从未见过如此近距离的导弹，”她说。第三天，有相当多的缅甸军用飞机和直升机在城市上空飞行，她补充道。

;

;“这几天，我的房子有时摇晃了几次，”她补充道。中国外交部部长助理农融周一表示，北京呼吁缅甸“切实保障中国边境地区居民的生命财产安全，并采取有效措施加强中国公民的安全”。

;

;对于中国是否批准兄弟联盟的行动，或者是否事先了解该联盟的情况，分析人士存在分歧。北京与其边境沿线的武装团体有联系，但否认向他们提供武器。中国与缅甸军方的关系长期以来一直很复杂，在政变后变得越来越令人担忧。

;

;“[中国]一直在尝试与缅甸军方合作，以取得快速进展。美国和平研究所缅甸项目国家主任贾森·塔尔斯 (Jason Towers) 表示：然而，他补充说，很明显，军政府没有合法性或能力来实施此类项目。

;

;中国也越来越担心自政变以来缅甸境内的诈骗活动激增。塔尔斯说，中国官员以强烈的语言表达了他们希望缅甸采取行动的愿望，但此类活动却在该国进一步扩大。

;
;

;;相关：;< a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/10/myanmar-at-least-30-people-killed-in-attack-on-camp-for-displaced-people">;缅甸：流离失所者营地遇袭，造成至少 29 人死亡;

;
;

;Maung Saungkha，政变后加入武装抵抗运动的著名诗人，及其组织缅族人民解放军与兄弟会联盟协调后表示，上周的行动已经在全国范围内引发了针对军队的更广泛的袭击浪潮。

;

;“每个人都看到了掸邦北部发生的事情。这样的一波又一波，还会一波接着一波。由于这一波规模很大，所以另一波也会和这一波一样大。”他说。

; Tue, 07 Nov 2023 12:22:01 +0800 WeWork files for bankruptcy after grappling with $2.9bn in long-term debthttps://www.theguardian.com/business/2023/nov/06/wework-bankruptcy-debt-remote-work
;;2023-11-07T02:37:42Z;
;
;;纽约的一栋 WeWork 大楼
;

;WeWork 周一在新泽西州申请破产法第 11 章据彭博社报道，根据法庭文件。

;

;这家陷入困境的公司一度在私人市场上估值为 470 亿美元，但今年股价下跌了 98%，使其市值减少超过 5000 万美元。 8 月份，由于面临 29 亿美元的长期净债务和超过 130 亿美元的长期租赁问题，该公司对其能否继续运营提出了“重大疑问”。

;

;WeWork 股票被停牌周一，华尔街准备申请破产，有报道称该公司正计划申请破产。

;

;该公司从未从其创始人 Adam Neumann 的下台中完全恢复过来，他于 2019 年 9 月辞职。上市的推动，以及冠状病毒大流行带来的远程工作革命。

;

;该公司试图于 2019 年以 We Company 在纽约证券交易所上市，其中包括向美国证券交易委员会对其长期生存能力、盈利能力和领导力提出了质疑。该公司要到 2021 年才会上市。诺伊曼退出时获得了 4.45 亿美元的回报。
;
;该公司成立于 2010 年，业务涉及办公楼的长期租赁以及向办公室出售短期会员资格面向联合办公。该公司的估值一度达到 470 亿美元，投资额为 128 亿美元，主要来自日本跨国公司软银。然而，在 S-1 招股说明书发布后，分析师对该公司的估值为 100 亿美元。
;
;WeWork 为应对大流行封锁而关闭了数十个联合办公空间，当时远程工作开始主导联合办公空间.
;
; 然而，其商业房地产投资组合仍然庞大，截至 6 月份在 39 个国家拥有约 777 个地点。据该公司称，这些中心设有 906,000 张办公桌。 （美国卫报从 WeWork 租赁空间。）
;
; WeWork 竞相适应后新冠时代的世界，寻求将自己定位为灵活办公空间的专业提供商，因为企业及其员工正在权衡如何以及在何处办公。工作。然而，该公司仍处于严重亏损状态，今年上半年亏损了 6.96 亿美元。
;
; 44 岁的 Neumann 已经开始了一家新企业。 Flow 去年从硅谷风险投资公司 Andreessen Horowitz 筹集了 3.5 亿美元，专注于住宅房地产。

; Tue, 07 Nov 2023 10:52:02 +0800 Hungary sacks museum chief for not enforcing under-18s ban at LGBT exhibitionhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/07/hungary-national-museum-director-fired-lgbt-homosexuality-laws
;;2023-11-07T00:28:47Z;
;
;;游客在匈牙利国家博物馆世界新闻摄影展上观看摄影记者 Hannah Reyes Morales 拍摄的《黄金同性恋者之家》
;

;尽管法律禁止向未成年人“宣扬同性恋”，但匈牙利政府仍允许 18 岁以下青少年参观以 LGBT 人群照片为主题的世界新闻摄影展，因此周一解雇了国家博物馆馆长。

;

;上个月，当极右翼 Mi Hazank（我们的祖国）政党就该问题发起政府调查时，围绕展览的紧张局势浮出水面。调查的核心照片，;黄金同性恋之家;由摄影记者汉娜·雷耶斯·莫拉莱斯 (Hannah Reyes Morales) 拍摄，追踪菲律宾马尼拉一家社区经营的 LGBT 人群老年护理院的居民。

;

;Mi Hazank 引用了 2021 年的一项法律，该法律禁止“展示和宣传同性恋”适合 18 岁以下青少年阅读的书籍和电影。

;
;

;;相关：;;匈牙利反 LGBT 法禁止 18 岁以下青少年参加世界新闻摄影展;

; ;

;总理维克托·欧尔班 (Viktor Orbán) 政府称该法律旨在保护儿童，但该法律受到了欧盟和人权组织的抨击。

;

;在政府调查后，博物馆表示，它已经无权要求参观者出示身份证件以确定年龄，但其网站上包含一条信息，呼吁 18 岁以下青少年不要参观展览。

;

;文化和创新部长周一表示，拉斯洛·西蒙 (Laszlo Simon)，博物馆馆长因未能遵守“机构的法律义务”而被解雇。

;

;西蒙在 Facebook 帖子中承认自己被解雇，但否认博物馆故意违反任何法律。他表示，该研究所已“立即”在其网站上标记了年龄限制。

;

;文化部和政府发言人没有立即回复路透社通过电子邮件发送的问题。

;

;西蒙– 欧尔班保守派青年民主联盟 (Fidesz party) 的前议员 – 在早些时候的 Facebook 帖子中感谢米·哈桑克 (Mi Hasank) 对展览的宣传，因为周末博物馆外排起了长队。

;

;今年，一些;匈牙利书商因销售描绘同性恋的书籍而被罚款;，未按照立法要求用塑料包裹。

; Tue, 07 Nov 2023 08:52:01 +0800 John Oliver backs ‘weird, puking’ pūteketeke as he takes New Zealand’s bird of century poll globalhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/07/john-oliver-backs-weird-puking-puteketeke-as-he-takes-new-zealands-bird-of-century-poll-global
;;2023-11-07T00:39:58Z;
;
;;约翰·奥利弗
;

;英国喜剧演员、美国脱口秀主持人约翰·奥利弗爆炸成新西兰的鸟儿世纪竞赛，开展全球运动，支持受到威胁的普特科特克。

;

;;每年为期两周的竞赛;通常会吸引总共约 60,000 张选票。自从奥利弗在美国周日播出的《上周今夜秀》中宣布自己为普特科特克的官方竞选经理以来，到目前为止，一夜之间就获得了同样数量的选票。

;

;“这就是民主的意义所在。 – 美国干涉外国选举，”他说。

;
;

;;相关：;;新西兰将在本世纪鸟类民意调查中添加灭绝物种以突出野生动物威胁;

;
;

;在节目中，;Oliver; 在世界各地的多个地点推出了广告牌，其中包括在英国的移动卡车广告牌，挑战英国人“帮助我们加冕真正的国王”，如 pūteketeke 和不是查尔斯国王。

;

;“它们是奇怪的呕吐鸟，身上有五颜六色的鲻鱼。有什么理由不爱这里呢？”奥利弗说，普特克特克会吃掉数百根羽毛来填饱肚子，然后再把它们吐出来。

; ;

;奥利弗赞扬了这只鸟的平等共同养育方式，即雄性和雌性轮流孵蛋。普特克特克不寻常的交配仪式也让奥利弗产生了共鸣，两只鸟“抓住一丛湿草，互相碰撞胸部，然后站在那里不确定下一步该做什么，”他说。

;

;奥利弗承认该节目的该活动“极其激进”，买下了新西兰、日本、法国、英国、印度和美国威斯康星州的广告牌。一架带有 pūteketeke 竞选横幅的飞机飞过巴西里约热内卢的海滩。

;

;“我不只是希望 pūteketeke 获胜。我希望它能在这场比赛历史上最大的压倒性胜利中获胜，”他一边穿过工作室，一边走到一个比他高两倍的巨大鸟木偶面前说道。

; ;

;该比赛此前曾经历过争议，包括;2021 年是蝙蝠，而不是鸟类。;

;

;每年，通常是当地的志愿者都会为选定的 75 种鸟类候选者开展竞选活动此次比赛由保护组织 Forest & 主办。鸟。奥利弗面对的是奥克兰一所小学，该小学正在为有声乐天赋的图伊进行竞选活动，而奥塔哥大学的研究生则代表跳岩企鹅。

;

;“不，我们并不介意。美国重量级人物上周今晚突然加入竞选活动。我们是咸的（而且充满了磷虾），因为我们是海鸟。”奥利弗​​表演后，企鹅官方活动 ;Instagram 帐户上这样写道.;

;

;微小的黄色 pīwauwau 岩鹪鹩 ;以约 2,800 票赢得 2022 年年度鸟类比赛;。截至上周五，当 Forest &根据世纪之鸟发言人埃伦·赖克斯 (Ellen Rykers) 的说法，伯德最后统计的结果是，啄羊鹦鹉（一种绿色高山鹦鹉）处于领先地位。

; Tue, 07 Nov 2023 08:52:01 +0800 China ‘world’s biggest debt collector’ as poorer nations struggle with its loanshttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/06/china-worlds-biggest-debt-collector-as-poorer-nations-struggle-with-its-loans
;;2023-11-06T23:00:50Z;
;
;;Kimuka 火车线路
;

;中国已成为世界上最大的收债国，因为它的钱一份新报告显示，发展中国家欠债已飙升至 1.1 万亿美元（8,890 亿英镑）至 1.5 万亿美元。据估计，中国在南半球的海外贷款组合中有 80% 目前正在支持陷入财务困境的国家。

;

;自 2017 年以来，中国一直是全球的;最大;双边贷款机构；其主要开发银行在 2008 年至 2021 年间发行了近 5000 亿美元。虽然其中一些早于 ;一带一路倡议;（BRI）是北京的旗舰发展计划，已调动了发展中国家的大量投资。

;

;但一份新报告由 William & 的 AidData 研究实验室的研究人员设计弗吉尼亚州一所公立大学玛丽发现，世界第二大经济体中国目前正在扮演国际收债人的角色，并成为重大基础设施项目的双边资助者。

;

;来自中国政府的贷款受支持的银行帮助肯尼亚建设铁路、柬埔寨发电厂以及数千个其他项目。 AidData 研究人员分析了 165 个低收入和中等收入国家的 20,985 个项目，这些项目在 2000 年至 2021 年间通过价值 1.34 兆美元的赠款和贷款融资。

;

;研究人员发现，随着中国贷款机构的债务不断增加暂停或取消的项目数量也有所增加。由于大量贷款流向陷入财务困境或面临财务困境风险的国家，北京现在越来越担心违约风险。

;

;6 月，赞比亚达成一项历史性协议，重组 63 亿美元的国家债务，其中三分之二欠中国两大政策性银行之一的中国进出口银行。

;

;为了降低未来违约风险，中国政策制定者采取了一系列措施，包括减少基础设施项目贷款，同时增加;紧急贷款;。 2015年，基础设施项目贷款占中国贷款总额的60%以上。到 2021 年，这一比例略高于 30%，其中紧急贷款占比近 60%。

;

;“中国的表现越来越像国际危机管理者，”研究人员总结道。中国为陷入金融困境的国家创建了“安全网”——“进而为那些面临高度风险的中国债权人”。

;
;

;;相关：;;中国在一带一路上花费了2400亿美元研究发现，从 2008 年到 2021 年的救助计划;

;
;

;中国银行试图降低风险敞口的另一种方法是提高逾期还款的处罚力度，此举可能会疏远借款人。 AidData报告援引盖洛普世界民意调查的数据显示，低收入和中等收入国家对中国的公众支持率从2019年的56%下降到2021年的40%。

;

;具体的中国贷款往往不透明，但经济学家 ;据估计，中国政府向低收入国家提供的贷款利率通常为 2%，而世界银行优惠贷款的利率标准为 1.54%。但AidData研究人员发现，在“一带一路”倡议初期（2014-2017年）和后期（2018-2021年）期间，中国贷方将逾期还款的最高罚金利率从3%提高到8.7%。

;该报告的作者之一、AidData 的执行董事布拉德利·帕克斯 (Bradley Parks) 表示：“在许多最大的借款人缺乏流动性或无力偿债的情况下，北京正在努力寻找自己作为世界上最大的官方收债机构的地位。而且收债人并没有赢得很多人气竞赛。”

;

;不过，帕克斯指出，“中国不会袖手旁观，眼睁睁地看着其旗舰全球基础设施计划崩溃和烧毁。”帕克斯表示，北京目前正在执行一项“救援任务”，以最大程度地减少债务困扰，但政府也在“打持久战”。 “它正在制定一套贷款偿还保障措施……旨在确保‘一带一路’倡议面向未来。”

; Tue, 07 Nov 2023 06:22:02 +0800 Unopened 18th-century love letters to French sailors read for first timehttps://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2023/nov/06/unopened-18th-century-love-letters-to-french-sailors-read-for-first-time
;;2023-11-06T19:01:45Z;
;
;;Bundles of letters tied with ribbon.
;

;A forgotten bundle of love letters sent to French sailors more than 260 years ago – but never before opened or read – has been discovered among British naval archives, revealing intimate details of 18th-century marital and family life.

;

;The remarkable stash of more than 100 letters was discovered by chance at the National Archives in Kew by Renaud Morieux, professor of European history at the University of Cambridge, who asked archivists if they could be opened so he could read them for the first time.

;

;Inside, he found deeply personal and often passionate messages intended for the sailors, who had been captured in 1758 onboard a French warship during the ;seven years' war;.

;

;“I cannot wait to possess you,” wrote one naval wife, Anne Le Cerf, to her husband, Jean Topsent, a phrase that can be translated as “embrace” or “make love to you”. She signed her note “Your obedient wife Nanette”, an affectionate nickname. Topsent, a noncommissioned officer, was imprisoned in England and would never receive the letter.

;

;Marie Dubosc, another correspondent, wrote to her husband, Louis Chambrelan, the first lieutenant of the captured warship: “I could spend the night writing to you … I am your forever faithful wife. Good night, my dear friend.现在是午夜。 I think it is time for me to rest.” The couple would never meet again, as she died the following year in Le Havre, almost certainly before he was released.

;

;The letters were intended for the crew of the Galatée, which was sailing from Bordeaux to Quebec when it was seized by a British vessel and taken to Portsmouth, where they were imprisoned.

;

;The French postal administration had been trying for months to deliver letters to the ship from the crew's loved ones, sending copies to ports in France – as was common practice at the time – in the hope of catching the vessel before it sailed. When it heard the Galatée had been captured, it forwarded the letters to the admiralty in London, hoping they would be passed on to the prisoners.

;

;Instead, after establishing the correspondence contained nothing of military value, the British authorities put the unopened letters in storage, where they would be forgotten for centuries until discovered by chance by Morieux.

;

;“I only ordered the box out of curiosity,” said Morieux. “There were three piles of letters held together by ribbon. The letters were very small and were sealed so I asked the archivist if they could be opened and he did.

;

;“I realised I was the first person to read these very personal messages since they were written. Their intended recipients didn't get that chance. It was very emotional.”

; ;

;As well as billets-doux between lovers, the archive offers rare insights into sometimes strained family relationships at a time of war. The mother of one young sailor, Nicolas Quesnel, wrote to him complaining that he wrote to his fiance more than to her. “Give my compliments to Varin [a shipmate],” she wrote. “It is only his wife who gives me your news.”

;

;The bundle also contains a letter from Quesnel's fiance, Marianne, asking him to send his mother a note and stop putting her in an awkward position. She later writes: “The black cloud has gone, a letter that your mother has received from you lightens the mood.”

;

;Morieux, who carried out genealogical research on the sailors, discovered Quesnel survived his imprisonment and later joined the crew of a transatlantic slave ship in the 1760s.

;

;With 59% of the letters written by women, Morieux said they “shatter the old-fashioned notion that war is all about men. While their men were gone, women ran the household economy and took crucial economic and political decisions”.

;

;He added: “These letters are about universal human experiences, they're not unique to France or the 18th century. They reveal how we all cope with major life challenges.”

;

;His findings are published in the journal Annales. Histoire, Sciences Sociales.

;

;The actor and comedian James Corden has struck a deal with SiriusXM to create a new audio interview series, after leaving CBS's The Late Late Show in April to spend more time with his wife and children.

;

;The podcast will “seek to tell the untold stories of some of the most well-known public figures”, a spokesperson said.

;

;Corden, who starred in the BBC sitcom Gavin & Stacey as well as Hollywood movies including Peter Rabbit and Cats, shot to fame in the US after he became a late night TV show host who interviewed other celebrities in a car, while encouraging them to belt out songs. The format became known as ;Carpool Karaoke;.

;

;His new audio show, This Life of Mine, will only be available for subscribers to SiriusXM, an American provider of satellite and online radio services.

;

;Expected to premiere early next year, it will feature in-depth discussions with the world's biggest stars as they discuss “the people, places, moments and memories that made them who they are today”.

;

;Rather like Desert Island Discs, the interviewees will be expected to converse with Corden about their favourite music, films and books, as well offering up advice and “untold stories” about their lives.

;

;“I am thrilled to be joining SiriusXM,” Corden said in a statement. “It's a dream to have a space to engage in deep conversations with the people whose work and talent I greatly admire.”

;

;Corden ;interviewed Adele in the last Carpool Karaoke; on The Late Late Show in April. Her ;original Carpool Karaoke interview; with Corden in 2016 became a viral hit, amassing more than 260m views.

;

;In 2022, Corden admitted he had been “ungracious” during an incident at a New York restaurant that led to him being banned from the venue.

;

;The restaurant owner, Keith McNally, said Corden had been “extremely nasty” to staff on two separate occasions while dining at his restaurant, Balthazar.

;

;Corden said at the time: “I made a rude, rude comment. And it was wrong.”

;

;Later that year, he told the Guardian he was planning to leave The Late Late Show. “The only thing I knew when I took the job was that I wasn't going to be sat there 20 years later saying: 'Stick around everybody, we'll be right back.' If I'm honest I thought it'd be cancelled within six months.”

; Tue, 07 Nov 2023 04:22:01 +0800 Tusk forced to wait as PiS given first chance to form Polish governmenthttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/06/tusk-forced-to-wait-as-pis-given-first-chance-to-form-polish-government
;;2023-11-06T20:07:08Z;
;
;;Donald Tusk
;

;Donald Tusk, who declared victory in last ;month's Polish parliamentary election;, will have to wait several weeks before having a chance to form a government after the president, Andrzej Duda, said he would offer the first chance to do so to the ruling Law and Justice (PiS) party.

;

;PiS, the nationalist, populist party that has governed Poland for the past eight years, won the most votes of any party in the election but fell far short of a majority of seats in parliament. All other parties have ruled out entering a coalition with them, leaving them without any obvious path to retain power.

;

;A broad coalition of opposition forces, the biggest of which is led by Tusk, the former prime minister and European Council president, have said they are ready and willing to form a government.

;

;Constitutionally, however, the president chooses who gets the first shot at forming a coalition. ;Duda, who has long been aligned with PiS, has taken his time to make a decision;, which has been seen by many as a time-wasting tactic.

;

;On Monday evening, in a televised address, Duda said he had held consultations with PiS and Tusk's Civic Coalition and both had claimed to be confident of forming a government.

;

;“Both – the representatives of Law and Justice, which obtained the best result in the elections, and the Civic Coalition, which took second place – presented their candidates for prime minister and expressed their will to form a government,” said Duda.

;

;“Therefore, I decided to continue the good parliamentary tradition, according to which the opportunity to form a government is given to the winning party.”

;

;Duda nominated the PiS prime minister, Mateusz Morawiecki, as his candidate. When the Sejm, the lower house of Poland's parliament, reconvenes next Monday, Morawiecki will have two weeks to attempt to form a working majority. PiS figures have claimed they still have a chance to build a coalition.

;

;“The chance that we will create a parliamentary majority is very low, but that does not mean it is zero,” the deputy foreign minister, Paweł Jabłoński, said on Monday.

;

;Assuming that Morawiecki fails to find a majority, after two weeks the Sejm will be able to nominate its own candidate. This is likely to be Tusk, who would then lead a broad grouping of opposition forces, including Civic Coalition, the centre-right Third Way and the leftist Lewica.

;

;Over the past weeks, Tusk and other leaders have been meeting to hash out a broad coalition agreement and distribute ministries and other key jobs.

;

;“The coalition is finalised in every detail and I hope that the president also hears it,” said Tusk on Monday, before Duda's announcement.

;

;Duda said if Morawiecki fails to put together a government and the parliament chooses its own prime ministerial candidate, he would respect the process.

;

;“If the mission of the representative of Law and Justice fails, then in the next step, the Sejm will choose a candidate for prime minister, and I will immediately appoint him to this position. All constitutional rules and deadlines will be respected,” he said.

;

;The election, on 15 October, followed a vicious and bitter campaign as PiS sought to win a third term in office. PiS mixed increased social spending with rightwing, populist rhetoric, attacking migrants and LGBT people and tightening Poland's already restrictive abortion laws.

;

;During the campaign, PiS's chair, Jarosław Kaczyński, called Tusk “the personification of evil” and suggested he was a traitor. Tusk, for his part, said the election was the last chance to save democracy in Poland, and promised legal retribution for those who committed abuses of office during the PiS years.

;

;Tusk has said his priorities in power would include de-politicising key state institutions that were taken over by PiS loyalists. However, he will be ;limited in his room for manoeuvre; by Duda, who will be in office until 2025 and has veto power over any legal initiatives, and by the breadth of his own coalition. Some of the more conservative elements of the coalition have already said they would not support legalising abortion up to 12 weeks, one of Tusk's campaign promises.

; Tue, 07 Nov 2023 04:22:01 +0800 Hispanic and Latino representation in film hasn’t improved for 16 years – studyhttps://www.theguardian.com/film/2023/nov/06/hispanic-latino-representation-movie-usc-study
;;2023-11-06T18:09:54Z;
;
;;Jennifer Lopez in Marry Me.
;

;Hispanics and Latinos remain underrepresented in film, a trend that has carried for 16 years, according to a new report from the University of Southern California. Even when movies did feature Hispanic or Latino characters, they were usually stereotyped as immigrant or as having low income.

;

;The latest ;study; from the Annenberg Inclusion Initiative examined 1,600 of the top-grossing films released between 2007 and 2022 and more than 62,000 speaking characters, as well as 13,000 directors, producers and casting directors.

;

;In the 16 years examined, only 75 (4.4%) actors in lead or co-lead roles were Hispanic or Latino; only five were Hispanic/Latina actors 45 years or older, and three of those roles were played by Jennifer Lopez. Less than 1% of all lead/co-lead roles since 2007 went to Afro-Latino actors, while 2.6% of all lead actors were US-born Latinos. There was not one year examined in which all film distributors released at least one movie with a Hispanic or Latino lead/co-lead.

;

;“There is a clear and persistent lack of stories that center on Hispanic/Latino actors and the Hispanic/Latino experience,” said Ariana Case, the study's lead author. “Despite the profusion of talent from this community, there is a clear reluctance on the part of the entertainment industry to develop and distribute these stories.”

;

;Of the seven biggest distributors, four had fewer than 10 films with a Hispanic of Latino lead during that timeframe. Warner Brothers had the worst record of the major studios, according to the study, with just three movies featuring a Hispanic/Latino lead or co-lead role in the 16-year span.

;

;The study also found that when Hispanic/Latino characters were represented on-screen, depictions were often rife with stereotypes. Nearly a quarter (24.4%) of Hispanic/Latino leads were depicted as immigrants, and the same percentage shown as low income. More than half (57.8%) were depicted as criminals, and nearly half (46.2%) as violent criminals. Forty per cent were portrayed as angry or temperamental, and 31.1% were sexualized.

;

;Afro-Latinos were particularly underrepresented. The study found that across the 100 top movies of 2022, just one protagonist – Nathalie Emmanuel in The Invitation – was portrayed by an Afro-Latina, and only eight Afro-Latino actors were cast in lead/co-lead roles between 2007 and 2016, representing less than 1% of all lead roles.

;

;The same held true for intersectionality for Hispanic/Latino characters. The study revealed that more than 95% of movies from between 2014 and 2022 were missing LGBTQ+ Hispanic/Latino characters, and only 1.8% of Hispanic/Latino characters in 2022 were shown with a disability.

;

;“Hispanic/Latinos are not a monolithic community, but film offers a very narrow picture that does little to communicate how diverse this group is,” said Case. “There is almost no representation of the array of communities that encompass this ethnic group. Few women, few LGBTQ+ Hispanic/Latinos and very few Hispanic/Latinos with disabilities are shown in film.”

;

;Hispanic and Latinos remain underrepresented behind the camera, as well. Across 16 years and 1,600 movies, less than 5% of directors were Hispanic or Latino, and only five of those 82 were women. The majority of Hispanic/Latino directors (69.5%) were born outside the US. And across the same time period, 3.1% of “produced by” credits went to Hispanic or Latinos; women represented 21.8% of those credits and less than 1% of producers overall.

;

;The study offered roadmaps for change, including expanded casting lists, searches and expectations; supporting grants for Hispanic/Latino creatives behind and in front of the camera; and creating tax incentives for productions hiring Hispanic/Latino individuals above the line.
